Taco Soup By Timothy Carroll

Ingredients

  • 2 pounds ground beef
  • 1 envelope taco seasoning
  • 1 can (16 ounces) mild chili beans, undrained
  • 1 can (15-1/4 ounces) whole kernel corn, drained
  • 1 can (15 ounces) pinto beans, rinsed and drained
  • 1 can (10 ounces) diced tomato with green chiles
  • 1 envelope ranch salad dressing mix

Instructions

  1. Cook ground beef in a large pot along with chopped onion, crumbling and stirring occasionally until browned and adding jalapeno and garlic during last few minutes of browning.
  2. Stir in tomatoes with chiles, beef broth, tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, ranch dressing mix and season with salt and pepper to tastes.
  3. Cover pot with lid and simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  4. Add in corn, black beans and pinto beans and cook until heated through.
  5. Add 1/2 cup water to thin soup if desired. If using cilantro and lime add it now.
  6. Serve warm topped with desired toppings.
This Taco Soup recipe is a fall and winter staple! It’s an easy, protein packed soup full of zesty, crave-worthy flavor, plus it’s perfectly hearty and filling. It’s like chili’s soupier cousin and it’s loaded with all the best taco style ingredients!
